page.title: 15EDUCATION FACILITIES
page.content: In Linkenholt and Faccombe small village school buildings still exist but are now used as estate offices. Children under 11 years of age living in Faccombe attend Hurstbourne Tarrant School while those from Linkenholt attend Vernham Dean School. From age 11 to 16 the majority attend John Hanson Comprehensive School in Andover and those wishing to continue their education after 16 attend Cricklade college, Andover. These schools and college come under the Education Dept. of Hampshire County Council to provide free education for boys and girls in mixed classes. A few children attend fee-paying and boarding schools. As the villages are situated more than 2 miles from any school, the children at state schools are provided with free transport. School meals are provided in the middle of the day.
